chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan M. Petterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *114 days of incarceration credit, if revoked

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*Pay restitution in the amount of $735.70 to H.P. on 22CM94
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

*No Contact with H.P.  - contact only if the agent and H.P. agree and it is deemed appropriate 
*No contact with the children, unless there is a family court order in place 
*No contact with M.D. or any member of her family or be within 1000 feet of her residence

*Complete a mental health assessment and comply with an recommended treatment or counseling
*Take medications as prescribed
*Sign any releases for agent to verify he is in compliance 
*Participate in any counseling, assessments or treatment as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Complete anger management or other treatment and comply with any treatment recommendations
*Submit DNA Sample

Count 1:  Sentence Withheld 
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In

10:43 AM Defendant Bryan M. Petterson in court, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Bryan M. Petterson.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF289 & 22CM94.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CM94:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

22CF289:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CM94:  Criminal Damage to Property 943.01(1) domestic abuse 968.075(1)(a) and guilty of Count 1 in 22CF289:  Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor or Law Enforcement Officer 940.203(2).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:  Count 2 of 22CM94 and Count 2 of 22CF289.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim(s) are present and give victim impact statements.

Victim/Witness Coordinator will be reading the victim impact statement on behalf of H.P.
M.D. gives her victim impact statement 
ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

BY THE COURT: 
22CF289:
Count 1 - 
Sentence Withheld 
114 days of incarceration credit, if revoked
Placed on Probation for a Period of 30 Months -
**Conditions of Probation:
*Pay restitution in the amount of $735.70 to H.P. on 22CM94
*No Contact with H.P.  - contact only if the agent and H.P. agree and it is deemed appropriate 
*No contact with the children, unless there is a family court order in place 
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
*No contact with M.D. or any member of her family or be within 1000 feet of her residence
*Complete a mental health assessment and comply with an recommended treatment or counseling
*Take medications as prescribed
*Sign any releases for agent to verify he is in compliance 
*Participate in any counseling, assessments or treatment as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Complete anger management or other treatment and comply with any treatment recommendations
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Submit DNA Sample

22CM94:
Count 1 -
Impose but STAY a 60 day jail sentence
Huber for work, school or treatment
Placed on Probation for a Period of 12 Months -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 of 22CF289
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample

3:37 PM Defendant Bryan M. Petterson in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Bryan M. Petterson.

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
